snippet: Perhaps the most damning testimony in the trial of James (Whitey) Bulger, the second-most notorious man in Boston, came late this week from a hearing-impaired witness of 79.
abstract: Dan Barry This Land column describes scene at trial of James (Whitey) Bulger, where his former partner Stephen Flemmi, killer serving a life sentence in prison, delivers some of most damning testimony against Bulger for assorted crimes; Flemmi also describes Bulger as a federal informant, which Bulger vehemently denies.
lead_paragraph: Perhaps the most damning testimony in the trial of James (Whitey) Bulger, the second-most notorious man in Boston, came late this week from a hearing-impaired witness of 79.

headline.print_headline: In Bulger Trial, Old Partners Meet, on Opposite Sides
headline.main: In Bulger Trial, Old Partners Meet, on Opposite Sides
